intro: Sticherus, commonly known as the common sticherus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves, which often have a distinctive scent. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is found in various regions across the Northern Hemisphere. Sticherus species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The genus includes several species, each with slight variations in appearance and habitat preferences.
